title: What materials, science, and skills are needed to be taught and mastered by the young climate activist, and any useful resources? - Quora

response.answer_text: What materials, science, and skills are needed to be taught and mastered by the young climate activist, and any useful resources? No need to worry about science. All the young climate activist needs to know is that 97 percent of scientists say the world will boil over in eleven years unless we bring down capitalism and the patriarchy. Skills are mostly social, eg shouting, singing and dancing in the streets. Other skills needed are map-reading, so as to coordinate maximum disruption of cities, and breaking through padlocked gates to daub paint on buildings owned by polluting capitalists. Materials must include superglue to stick yourself to cars, trains, railings and the reception areas of offices of the aforementioned polluting capitalists. They must ideally be too posh to work with a supercilious disregard for working people trying to go about their business. Here is the training video: https://banned.video/watch?id=5da0a9167c5c42001315ee6b

To me the use of the term Activist here rings warning bells. If you really want to be useful to society on climate matters then you need to equip yourself with the technical and scientific knowledge to enable you to honestly make a contribution. Activism without that is just a pain in the neck for the rest of us. For starters you need to convince yourself whether the CAGW Meme is valid or not and back that up with your own detailed analysis, free of influence from the opinions of others. That will take a great deal of effort, particularly as there is currently a relentless propaganda agenda in place selling it’s validity. Perhaps one should start by asking why there is this propaganda and what it is that needs hiding.

Their best tools are: Thorough knowledge of the scientific methodA sound grounding in the history of the evolution of the planet and the causes and effects of itA determination to find what is there, not what they want to findThe knowledge that Man is a part of Nature, and not separate from itThe knowledge that there was no time in the history of the earth when things were “normal”An understanding of chemistryAn understanding earth science and all the forces that influence climate.I have never forgotten my high school science teacher thundering “When talking about the earth, ten thousand years isn’t enough evidence; a million years isn’t enough evidence; ten million years isn’t enough evidence. . . .”

Miriam, we are not going to win this war against corrupt government & corporatism in regards to stopping the burning of fossil fuels & reducing the severity of climate change disasters. The best thing that activists can do now is prepare, & look after themselves & their families. In order to do this, they need to leave the city & go off grid, failing this they need to learn primitive living & survival skills & they need to collect some very basic tools. We are running out of time fast Miriam.'Uninhabitable hell': Climate change and disease threaten millions  Welcome to the Anthropocene Age. Will it be the end of us?  ‘High likelihood of human civilisation coming to end’ by 2050, report finds  Human society has 90% chance of collapsing in the next few decades. But why?  Inquiry hears natural disasters likely to become more intense and frequent in future | Sky News Australia  Anthropogenic climate change accelerating faster than earlier, natural analogs - Advanced Science News  Climate change is only going to make health crises like coronavirus more frequent and worse  'My home is touched by the sea': Climate change displacing one person every two seconds, Oxfam says  'Uninhabitable Hell:' UN Report Warns of Planet's Future for Millions Without Climate Action  All we have to do to save the human race from extinction is to stop burning fossil fuels, but it seems that this is too much to ask. The people prefer death over changing society & their environmentally damaging city lifestyles!!! Keith.

With the Sun into a Grand Solar Minimum phase; its lowest energy output in two centuries, the knowledge and skills needed are those that help adapt to a global cooling trend. At the top of the list would be shelter, and food production. As stated by space scientist Abdussamatov, “The Sun defines the climate, not carbon dioxide. The so-called ‘greenhouse effect’ will not avert the onset of the next deep temperature drop, the 19th in the last 7500 years, which without fail follows after natural warming. . . . Humanity must survive the serious economic, social, demographic and political consequences of a global temperature drop, which will directly affect the national interests of almost all countries and more than 80% of the population of the Earth.”

Communication skills and economics are key today. Tomorrow, you might need leadership and DIY skills. Here are some resources to get you started: DIY: Blueprints for Civilization. Build Yourself. Home | Open Source Ecology  Communication The uncertainty handbook - Climate Outreach Expert advice on communicating uncertainty into a few pages of practical, easy-to-apply techniques, providing you with the tools to communicate more effectively around climate change.  Leadership: start with why - Google Search Start with Why: How Great Leaders Inspire Everyone to Take Action  I am open for suggestions on economics and might add a resources later. Enjoy your learning journey!

Read up on the science. Take a university course if possible. Don’t skip the math and the physics. Learn to distinguish between a worst-case scenario and an actual prediction. And between “maybe, someday” problems like sea level rise and “definitely, today” problems like heat waves and wildfires. The issue is badly polarized - try not to be part of that problem. Good luck!
Absolutely none whatsoever, environmental activism requires a good amount of knowledge; however, climate activism requires about as much knowledge as is needed to scratch your arm pit.

The only thing a “climate activist” needs is an irritating personality, a feeling of superiority and a megaphone. Science doesn’t eve come into the picture. Do you think Gresta whatever her name is has any skills in science?
If you want o be an activist you don’t need to learn anything at all. And if you manage to learn some real knowledge, you shall not be an activist.
Don’t waste your time studying climate change. Man cannot alter the climate. Get yourself an engineering, physics, math or chemistry degree and create something useful.
